Authors: C. Q. Wang, T. H. Li, W. Q. Deng, M. Zhang
Title:
A new species of Hygrocybe subsect. Squamulosae from southern
China
Abstract:
Hygrocybe sparifolia sp. nov. is described and illustrated
based on both morphological characteristics and phylogenetic analysis
according to collections from Nankunshan Nature Researve in Guangdong
Province, South China. Morphologically, it is distinctive in the
following combined characters: the fibrillose pileus, shallow and sparse
lamellae with pink or purplish discoloration when bruised and basidia
and pileipellis with brown intracellular pigment. Phylogenetic analyses
inferred from ITS sequences also suggest that it is a distinct taxon
nerghbouring H. caespitosa, H. griseobrunnea and H. melleofusca.
